titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the C.I. Taylor Letter from Albacete, Spain TAM.790
titlestmt.author: Alexandra Gomer

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: C.I. Taylor Letter from Albacete, Spain
did.abstract: C.I. Taylor was an American volunteer who served in the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939). The letter in the collection describes his experience as a machine gunner in the Tom Mooney Company and his time spent at the headquarters in Albacete, Spain.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: C.I. Taylor was an American volunteer who went to fight against fascism in Spain during the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) as a machine gunner. While the American volunteers are often referred to as the Abraham Lincoln Battalion, the machine gun company named and referred to themselves after the imprisoned labor leader Tom Mooney. Taylor also writes from Albacete, Spain, which served as headquarters of the International Brigades.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Elizabeth Rogers, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2017 by Elizabeth Rogers. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Elizabeth Rogers, 2019. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.040.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; C.I. Taylor Letter from Albacete, Spain; TAM 790; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an achival box and folder, and described on the collection-level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains one letter from C.I. Taylor, an American volunteer who served in the Spanish Civil War. The letter describes Taylor's experience of being a machine gunner in the Tom Mooney Battalion, a name the machine gun company used for what is also known as the Lincoln Battalion. Also included are two typed transcripts of the letter and one illustration dated from 2016.
